info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 23 at 10:28AM EDT until August 23 at 10:45AM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM EDT FOR EASTERN OAKLAND AND MACOMB COUNTIES... At 1028 AM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Mount Clemens, moving southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to vehicles is expected. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of eastern Oakland and Macomb Counties, including the following locations... Roseville, Shelby Township, Ray Center, Utica, Washington, Auburn Hills, Pleasant Ridge, Center Line, Chesterfield Township and Clinton Township. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
